verse_data: त्वं चापि कुशली राजन्माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ

verse_translation.google_trans: Fortunately, Gandhivadhanva and Pandavas and Vrikodara You are also well, O king, and the Pandavas, the sons of Madri.

verse_translation.google_trans: He lies on his autumn body, your enemy, O chief of the Kurus. Look at him, O tiger among men, with various arrows.

verse_translation.google_trans: By your grace, the two are fulfilled, O man, O best of men. You and Gandhivadhanva victorious Yadunandana Fortunately, O Govinda, fortunately, Karna is dropped.
